meanings.definition: The arrangement of and relations between the parts or elements of something complex.
meanings.sent1: The structure of the building was carefully planned to ensure stability.
meanings.sent2: She studied the structure of the sentence to understand its meaning.
meanings.sent3: The structure of the puzzle was so confusing that it took hours to solve.
meanings.sent4: The structure of the family resembled a tightly knit web of relationships.
meanings.sent5: The intricate structure of the spider's web glistened in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The way in which the parts of a system or object are arranged or organized.
meanings.sent1: The organizational structure of the company was hierarchical.
meanings.sent2: The structure of the essay was clear and easy to follow.
meanings.sent3: The structure of the game was so well-designed that it kept everyone entertained.
meanings.sent4: The structure of the argument crumbled under scrutiny.
meanings.sent5: The structure of the music piece was harmonious and pleasing to the ears.

meanings.definition: Construct or arrange according to a plan; give a pattern or organization to.
meanings.sent1: She decided to structure her day by creating a detailed schedule.
meanings.sent2: The architect structured the building to withstand earthquakes.
meanings.sent3: He structured his speech in a way that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent4: The team structured the project timeline for maximum efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The artist structured the painting with bold strokes and vibrant colors.
